summary: To obtain a full-time position in a healthcare environment leveraging 16 years of experience in healthcare, including customer relations, claims, coding, billing, human resources and employee management.
skills: Knowledge of HMOs, Medicare and Medi-Cal
Advanced knowledge in HMO and Managed Care

experience.title: Business Office Manager
experience.description: Oversee employee management, new-hire training, policy development, and departmental procedures; manage accounts receivable, Medicare/Medi-Cal processes, insurance appeals and grievances; supervise medical records, HIPAA compliance, and continuing education; coordinate subpoenas and legal communications; ensure accuracy and cash flow; provide leadership to staff.

experience.title: Healthcare Administrator
experience.description: Manage ambulance licensing and documentation, EMT/DMV checks, and employee file accuracy; oversee business office operations, medical records, contracts and proposals; ensure HIPAA compliance; update staff on HIPAA; coordinate dialysis patient transport and ambulance services.

experience.title: Business Office Supervisor
experience.description: Supervised billing department staff; ensured deadlines; Medicare/Medi-Cal and major insurance billing; manage EOBs, data entry, and AR/AP; create contracts with major insurers; CPT/ICD-9/HCPCS coding; attended Medicare/Medi-Cal workshops; prepared medical necessity letters for ambulance services.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Health Administration
Certificate-Diploma in Medical Claims and Billing Specialist
